bill.title: RPM Act of 2017
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 4 (Friday, January 6, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McHENRY:H.R. 350.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3: ``To regulate Commerce withforeign nations, and among the several states, and with theIndian Tribes.''Because the federal government has extended Article I,Section 8, Clause 3 beyond its intended boundaries, itfollows that efforts to rein in excessive federal governmentencroachment in this area can be justified by Article I,Section 8, Clause 3.[Page H195]

item.text:
Recognizing the Protection of Motorsports Act of 2017 or the RPM Act of 2017

This bill amends the Clean Air Act to allow the modification of a vehicle's air emission controls if the vehicle is used solely for competition.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.title: Recognizing the Protection of Motorsports Act of 2017
To exclude vehicles used solely for competition from certain provisions of the Clean Air Act, and for other purposes.
RPM Act of 2017
item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
